org.janusgraph.core

Interface VertexLabel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.Element, org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.util.Host, Idfiable, JanusGraphElement, JanusGraphSchemaElement, JanusGraphSchemaType, JanusGraphVertex, Namifiable, Removable, org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.Vertex
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    InternalVertexLabel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseVertexLabel, VertexLabelVertex

    public interface VertexLabel
extends JanusGraphVertex, JanusGraphSchemaType
    A vertex label is a label attached to vertices in a JanusGraph graph. This can be used to define the nature of a vertex.

    Internally, a vertex label is also used to specify certain characteristics of vertices that have a given label.

    Author:
    Matthias Broecheler (me@matthiasb.com)
